content.heading: Arithmetic Progression
content.content:
An arithmetic progression is a sequence of numbers in which the difference of any two successive members is a constant called the common difference. The general form of an arithmetic sequence is: a, a + d, a + 2d, a + 3d, ... where a is the first term and d is the common difference.
The key formulas of Arithemtic Progression are:
1. nth term of an AP: a + (n-1)d
2. Sum of first n terms of an AP: n/2[2a + (n-1)d]

content.heading: Geometric Progression
content.content:
A geometric progression is a sequence of numbers in which the ratio of any two successive members is a constant called the common ratio. The general form of a geometric sequence is: a, ar, ar^2, ar^3, ... where a is the first term and r is the common ratio.
The key formulas of Geometric Progression are:
1. nth term of a GP: ar^(n-1)
2. Sum of first n terms of a GP: a(r^n - 1)/(r - 1)
